metadata.title: CVE-2021-32029 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in postgresql. Using an UPDATE ... RETURNING command on a purpose-crafted table, an authenticated database user could read arbitrary bytes of server memory. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-32029` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 13.3-1
libecpg6 - 13.3-1
libpgtypes3 - 13.3-1
libpq5 - 13.3-1
postgresql-13 - 13.3-1
postgresql-client-13 - 13.3-1
postgresql-plperl-13 - 13.3-1
postgresql-plpython3-13 - 13.3-1
postgresql-pltcl-13 - 13.3-1
No subscription required

notes.note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.1 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as ignored in precise. PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. avital> Affects versions 11 - 13

criterions.comment: postgresql-13 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '13.3-1').
